As someone who was born in the Jim Crow South, I can tell you that opposing voting rights legislation not only puts you on the side of Jim Crow, it puts you on the side of the folks who attacked our Capitol and tried to overthrow our democratically elected leadership. https://t.co/PLuS06WaIS
Let‚Äôs move forward: let‚Äôs pass the Freedom to Vote: John R. Lewis Act and give the power to hold politicians accountable back to the people. https://t.co/WxbdBxv9UC

As we‚Äôve seen with the attacks on the Capitol and democracy itself, extremists are willing to ignore the results of free and fair elections. 

That‚Äôs why it‚Äôs more important than ever that we secure voting rights now and for future generations.
Gerrymandering cracks and packs the political power of minority voters, and unfair election laws target us with surgical precision.

Our sacred right to vote is the right from which every other right in a democracy follows. It‚Äôs the most basic way to hold our policy makers accountable, because sometimes you can‚Äôt change policy without changing policy makers.
However, that right is under attack. https://t.co/IV1shZqmD2
